alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 8:46PM CDT until June 08 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Harrah affecting Lincoln, Oklahoma and Pottawatomie Counties.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC081-109-125-081400- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.Y.0022.000000T0000Z-220608T1400Z/ /HRHO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 846 PM CDT Tue Jun 7 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Harrah. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Shallow flooding of low-lying areas along the river occurs in eastern Oklahoma County... the southwest corner of Lincoln County... and northwestern Pottawatomie County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest around 11.7 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
